resources.string: Ready to connect when network quality improves
Checking the quality of your Internet connection…
Connected to device for Internet access.
Allow this paired device to access your messages.
Allow this paired device to access your SIM card.
Enable Bluetooth tethering on the paired device to access the Internet on this device.
Connected for call and media audio
Unable to pair with %1$s. Make sure %2$s is ready to pair.
"Can't connect to %1$s. Check your settings in %2$s and try again."
Device name will appear when this device is connected.
Speed at which the text is spoken.
Set language-specific voice for spoken text.
Play short demonstration of speech synthesis.
Install voice data required for speech synthesis.
This speech synthesis engine may collect all speech, including passwords, credit card numbers, and other personal data. Continue?
A network connection is required to support %s
Reset the pitch at which text is read out to the default setting.
%1$s: %2$s left until fully charged via AC
%1$s: %2$s left until fully charged via USB
Unable to use Bluetooth tethering while connected to Wi-Fi network.
You cannot make outgoing calls while call barring is on.
All calls are restricted by access control.
Emergency calls are restricted by access control.
Normal calls are restricted by access control.
No voicemail number on SIM card
Your SIM card has been unblocked. Your phone is unlocking…
SIM network PIN blocked. Enter SIM network PUK.
PIN to unlock SIM network subset
PIN to unlock SIM service provider

This device can be remotely unlocked if eligible. Please use the “Device Unlock” application to unlock the device. Make sure the device has an internet connectivity to use the “Device Unlock” application.
Requesting to unlock SIM network subset…
Requesting to unlock SIM service provider…
Unable to unlock SIM network subset.
Swipe to call or send messages
Swipe contacts and recent calls right to call them or left to message them.
"Make calls or send messages by swiping right or left across a contact's information in Contacts, or a log item in Phone."
"Make calls by swiping to the right across a contact's information in Contacts or a log item in Phone."
Only show contacts with phone numbers on the CONTACTS tab.
Show my number in outgoing calls according to the default operator settings.
Receive incoming call alerts during calls.
Receive incoming call alerts during calls.
Select when to forward incoming calls.
Unable to deactivate call diverting when busy. Not supported by operator
Unable to deactivate call forwarding when busy
Unable to deactivate call diverting for unanswered calls. Not supported by operator
Unable to deactivate call forwarding for unanswered calls
Unable to deactivate call diverting when phone is unreachable. Not supported by operator
Unable to deactivate call forwarding when phone is unreachable
Please turn on the radio before viewing these settings.
Your SIM card does not allow a connection to this network.
Scan for and connect to a network automatically.
Enable data access over mobile network.
Access the internet through your mobile network.
Enable mobile data services such as #mail, web browsing, AT&T Video Call and push notifications over the cellular network.
Enable mobile data services such as Email, web browsing and push notifications over the cellular network.

Enable mobile data services such as Email, web browsing, AT&T Video Call and push notifications over the cellular network when roaming outside the U.S., Puerto Rico and USVI. International roaming data charges will apply.

Enable mobile data services such as email, web browsing and push notifications over the cellular network when roaming outside the U.S., Puerto Rico and USVI. International roaming data charges will apply.
Connect to data services when roaming.
International data roaming charges apply to data usage outside of the US, Puerto Rico and USVI. Turn data roaming off to avoid international data roaming charges.
Using mobile data while roaming may result in additional charges.
You have lost data connectivity because you left your home network with data roaming turned off.
International roaming charges may apply. You can go to Settings > Connections > Mobile networks > Data roaming to turn on or off data.
Data roaming will be enabled. Using Mobile data while roaming may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Using mobile data while roaming may result in additional charges.
Caution, you may be charged an additional roaming fee depending on your current tariff. Please check with your service provider.
Allow data roaming? International data roaming charges apply to data usage outside the U.S., Puerto Rico and U.S.V.I.
When you are using Internet on roaming, it is recommended that you purchase a data package from your service provider. Using mobile data while roaming may result in additional charges.
Unable to change networks while data service in use. Stop using current data service and select another available network?
The China Telecom UIM/SIM card in the other slot will be unmounted.
Save the fixed dialing number or discard it?
TTY cannot be turned off during TTY call.
Unable to update FDN settings. Maximum number length (20 digits) exceeded.
No contacts on your SIM card
To import contacts from SIM card, disable Flight mode.
The old PIN you typed is incorrect. Please try again
The PINs you entered do not match. Please try again
Incorrect PIN2. SIM card is locked. Enter PUK2 to unlock it
The old PIN2 you typed is not correct. Please try again
The PIN2s you entered do not match. Please try again
Type a PIN2 that is 4 to 8 numbers
Password incorrect, please change PIN2 and retry!
Type PUK2 to unblock SIM card.
Enter the PUK2 to unblock your UIM card.
Flight mode on. Turn Flight mode off to make calls
Call not sent, no valid number entered.
Unable to call %s. Only emergency services or personal emergency contacts can be called.
Call not connected. Dial an emergency number
Unable to call %s. Only emergency services can be called.
Optimize the sound quality of your phone for hearing aids.
Special call is needed to activate your phone service. After pressing Activate, follow instructions to activate your phone

If you skip activation, you cannot make calls or connect to mobile data networks (though you can connect to Wi-Fi networks). Until you activate your phone, you will be asked to activate it each time you turn it on
Follow the spoken instructions until you hear that activation is completed
Phone is being programmed. Please wait
Phone activated. It may take up to 15 minutes for service to start
Phone activation failed. You may need to find an area with better signal (near windows or outside). Try again or call customer service for more options
SPC has failed too many times.
Selected action not available in Emergency callback mode.
Use Wi-Fi to make and receive calls whenever possible.

"This device supports Wi-Fi Calling. This allows you to keep using your phone in places where you don't have cellular coverage - like basements, condos and tall buildings. If you are using Wi-Fi Calling, the usage is deducted from your airtime/messaging buckets in your wireless plan."
Use Wi-Fi networks to make and receive calls anywhere, without connecting to a mobile network.

"To use this function, check that it is offered by your service provider, enable it in Call settings, then connect to a Wi-Fi network.
The icon below will be shown whenever this function is available."
Tap SETTINGS to set up Wi-Fi calling.
Receive and make/send calls and messages via a Wi-Fi network.
Create or delete custom vibration pattern
Play tone when the dialing keypad is tapped.
Unable to open %s. Only apps added to home screen can be used in Maximum power saving mode.
"Set an alternative image or video to be displayed on the other person's screen during video calls."
Show live image to caller when user accepts video call.
Use alternative methods to re-attempt failed call.
Modify my eyes to seem like I am looking at the screen during video calls.
Conference calling not available for video calls
Maximum number of call-reject messages (%d) reached.
"I can't talk right now. I'll call you back shortly."
"I'm busy at the moment. Please text me."
"I can't answer the phone right now. Please call back later."
Sorry, I am busy, please call back later.
"I am in a meeting. I'll call you later."
"I am in class now. I'll call you later."
"I am in the cinema. I'll call you later."
"I am driving. I'll call you later."
Reject calls from numbers on the auto reject list.
Manage the phone numbers from which calls will be blocked.
Block calls and messages from specific phone numbers.
Select the categories of callers whose calls will be blocked, or add specific numbers to block both calls and messages from them.
"You won't receive any calls or messages from this number."
You can now receive calls and messages from this number.
You will not receive calls from this number.
You can now receive calls from this number.
From Android Nougat onwards, Call blocking mode is replaced by Block numbers. Instead of just blocking calls, Block numbers will automatically block both calls and messages.
Tap SETTINGS to edit Block numbers.
The numbers you add will appear here.
The messages you add will appear here.
Manage the phone numbers from which calls and messages will be blocked.
Manage the phone numbers from which calls and messages will be allowed.
Blocking mode is turned off when making emergency calls.
When you make emergency calls, Blocking mode will be turned off automatically so that you can receive calls from the emergency services.
Blocking mode disabled when making emergency calls.
When you make emergency calls, Blocking mode will be disabled automatically so that you can receive calls from the emergency call acceptance organization.
Compose or edit response messages to send when rejecting incoming calls.
Compose or edit response messages to send when declining incoming calls.
Unable to paste text that includes emoticons.
Allow alarms and notifications to sound during calls.
Show incoming call notifications as pop-ups if another application is already open in full screen view.
Show ongoing calls in a pop-up instead of full screen while using other apps.
Show incoming calls on the %s when another application is already open in full screen view.
Show incoming calls on Edge screen
Show incoming calls on the Edge screen when another application is already open in full screen view.
Press Home key to answer calls
Press Home key to answer calls
Press Volume up to answer calls
Press the home key to accept incoming calls.
Press Power key to end calls
Press Power key to end calls
Press the power key to end calls when screen is on. This will not turn off the screen
Unable to set the power key to end calls while the proximity sensor is off. The proximity sensor will be turned on. During calls, the screen will be turned off when you bring your device to your ear.
Unable to turn off proximity sensor while the power key is set to end calls. The power key will no longer end calls
Say “Answer” or “Decline” to respond to incoming calls.
You can answer or decline calls by saying %1$s or %2$s. The speakerphone will turn on when you answer a call with a voice command.
"Voice commands aren't available when phone set to Vibrate."
To improve the recognition of the voice commands when answering or rejecting calls, try saying them during the gaps in your ringtone, when there is less background noise.
Accept incoming calls by tapping the accept call button on the incoming call screen.
Answer/end calls without opening the device by using the outer screen
Press and hold the Hold key to start or stop recording during calls.
Press the hold key to end calls. This will not turn off the screen.
Make calls only when device unlocked
Make calls even while the device is locked.
Automatically answer incoming calls after a set time while a headset or a Bluetooth device is connected.
Answer incoming calls automatically after %d seconds while a headset or a Bluetooth device is connected.
Adjust the amount of time before calls are automatically answered.
Add %d automatically to the number display panel.
Automatically add an area code to the number display panel.
"The caller's device vibrates when recipients answer the phone."
"The caller's device will vibrate when the call ends."
Turn on proximity sensor during calls.
Extra volume button is shown on screen during calls.
Ringtone volume increases when device is in pocket or bag.
Automatically redial if calls cannot connect or if they are disconnected.
Enable subaddress using asterisk character in phone number
Unable to save. No number entered.
No content to save. Rejection message discarded.
Some numbers already added to list.
All numbers already added to list.
Change incoming and outgoing international call settings.
Automatically block incoming calls from abroad. Some incoming calls from abroad with different country codes may not be blocked.
Notify me when international calls are received.
Set my call sound for during calls.
Find the best call sound for you.
Before you can use this function, you need to find the best call sound for you. Find now?
To use this function, go to Settings > Personalise call sound > Adapt sound, and personalize the sound after ending your current call.
Your recording has been saved in Voice Recorder.
Unable to record. Media scanner is running
Disconnect storage from PC before recording voice calls.
Roaming assistance helps you easily call your home country while you are roaming internationally.
"Automatically apply your home country code when calling contacts you've called before."
Dialing to the T roaming customer center
How to turn Roaming auto dial on or off

[Roaming auto dial]is available while you are roaming. This feature simplifies the dialing process by automatically inserting international call code and Korean country code (82) before a number you entered manually or selected from the phonebook or call log.

"You can make calls just as you would in Korea. Enter a number manually or select a number from the phonebook or call log and then select Call Korea. Example: To call 010-1234-5678 from Beijing to Korea, enter 010-1234-5678 (or select the number from phonebook or call log) and then select Call Korea."

"To call within a foreign country: Enter a number manually or select a number from the phonebook or call log and then select Call other countries. Example: To call a Beijing number while in Beijing, enter the number and then select Call other countries. To call another country while outside Korea: Enter the international call code, country code, and the number, and then select Call other countries. You can insert the international call code with a plus sign (press the 0 key) and must remove the first zero from the number. Example: To call 06-1234-5678 from Beijing, China to Osaka, Japan, enter +81-6-1234-5678, and then select Call other countries."
"If you have more questions, please contact the T roaming customer center. Enter 114 with the keypad and select Call Korea to contact the T roaming customer center (+82-2-6343-9000)."
How to turn Roaming auto dial on or off
"You can turn Roaming auto dial on or off. Select T roaming > Roaming auto dial and then select an option: On: turns on Roaming auto dial Off: turns off Roaming auto dial"
How to use the Current local time information service

[Current local time information service] is a free service that gives the local time in another country. To subscribe to this service, call T Roaming customer center. Enter 114 with the keypad and select Call Korea to call the T roaming customer center (+82-2-6343-9000).
Dialing to the MOFAT call center

"This service is supported by Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trades (MOFAT) and provides you with help in the following situations: Lost/Stolen - Contact information for local police station - Passport reissue / Travel certificate issue Injured/Dead - Local hospital information and translation Arrested/Imprisoned - Contact information for Korean embassies - Legal services / Translation Enter 112, 113, or 119 and then select Call Korea to contact the MOFAT call center (+82-2-3210-0404)"
You can set Roaming auto dial on roaming area.
You can inform Roaming auto dial on roaming area.
Video calls cannot be made to this phone number.
Failed to connect to mobile network via AT&T MicroCell. Try again.
This operation is not allowed during call.
Unable to enable or disable Call forwarding for CMCC SIM card during calls.
Unable to enable or disable Call barring for CMCC SIM card during calls.
Ultra power saving mode enabled. Unable to change mobile network during calls.
Ultra power saving mode disabled. Unable to change mobile network during calls.
Emergency mode or Ultra power saving mode enabled. Unable to change mobile network during calls.
Emergency mode or Ultra power saving mode disabled. Unable to change mobile network during calls.
Unable to search for networks while data service in use. Stop using current data service and search for other available networks?
Unable to select network. Select automatically.
Make/receive voice calls or use voicemail while using mobile networks.
Replaces + with international dialing code, except for +1
Set and change options for roaming.
Set and change options for Data roaming guard.
Change voice, text and data roaming settings, including international roaming.
Make/receive voice calls and send/receive text messages when roaming.
Make/receive voice calls and send/receive text messages when roaming internationally.
Connect to data services when roaming.
Connect to data services when roaming internationally. Requires international roaming plan. Faster data speeds may available for purchase.
Additional charges may apply per plan. Do you wish to enable this setting?
Domestic voice roaming must be selected for domestic data roaming to work. Additional charges may apply per plan. Do you wish to enable this setting?
International voice roaming must be selected for international data roaming to work. Additional charges may apply per plan. Do you wish to enable this setting?
To change setting, go to Settings > Connections > Mobile networks > Roaming > Set roam alerts.
Only update automatically when connected to a WLAN
The latest version will be downloaded.
You already have the latest version.
Unable to update. Network error occurred.
Unable to update. File error occurred.
"Phone number locator shows caller's region. Region can be updated using the server"
Auto update in progress. Try later.
This service is provided by Tencent Mobile Security Manager.
Tap here to enable this function and view the region information of callers.

"%2$s lets you know the region information of the caller.
%2$s uses content provided by Tencent. By using %2$s, you agree to Tencent’s %3$s.
Please note that %2$s requires a network connection."
Tap here to learn about and enable these functions.

"The features below are provided to assist you better during call communication.
%1$s helps you to conveniently identify callers with unsaved numbers.
%2$s lets you know the region information of the caller.
The features above use content provided by Tencent. By using the features above, you agree to Tencent’s %3$s.
Please note that the features above require a network connection."
%s needs to use network connections to work normally. Allow?
Connecting to mobile networks may incur additional charges.
The device will use data through the currently connected WLAN network.
WLAN is not available. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Data will be transferred in the background when the device is connected to a mobile network or WLAN
Call barring disabled for outgoing calls.
Call barring enabled for outgoing calls.
Enabled, without alerts, for incoming calls
Accept call automatically if Accept by voice call is selected.
Accept call automatically if Accept by voice call is selected.
Failed to connect to network. Try again later.
Insert the USIM card and restart your device.
Network not available. Select different network.
The device will automatically restart when the download is complete. Please wait…
Failed to register number. Try again?
The USIM will be ready to use after the registration is complete. Functions will be limited to emergency calls only.
The USIM will be ready to use after the registration is complete.
Failed to register USIM. If this problem persists, visit the retailer you purchased your mobile device from.
You need to register this device with LG U+ to use its full features. (Registration is not available during maintenance periods.)
Registering number. It may take up to 3 minutes…
Failed to register USIM. It is not connected to the LTE network. Restart your device or try again later.
Unregistered SIM cards cannot be used outside of your home country. Insert different USIM card.
Service will be available after the device automatically restarts.
USIM card information has been changed. Restart your device.
The USIM card information has been changed.
The USIM card is required to download USIM.
Restart your device to verify the USIM.
The device will turn off to download USIM. Please wait…
The USIM card has been removed. Restart your device.
You will no longer be able to use applications such as Internet, Email, and YouTube via mobile networks. Continue?
To select an international service provider for incoming roaming calls, contact the roaming center or customer center (+82-2-6343-9000).
Authentication failed. Dial 114 to contact help desk.
Date and time information available from network. Set date and time automatically? Enabling automatic date setting requires resetting
Restarting device to apply date and time settings…
Settings > Connections > Network connections > More networks > Mobile networks > Mobile data
"Mobile data is turned on by default. This may result in additional charges from your service provider depending on your payment plan. To turn off Mobile data, go to %s."
Phone configuration will be adapted according to your Internet tariff. Do you have a flat Internet tariff rate?

Mobile data is currently turned on. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan. To turn off Mobile data, go to Settings > Data usage, then select Mobile data. Multimedia messages can still be sent and received while Mobile data is turned off.

Mobile data is currently turned on. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan. To turn off Mobile data, go to Settings > More connection settings > Data usage, then select Mobile data. Multimedia messages can still be sent and received while Mobile data is turned off.
Roaming disabled. Tap here to enable.
Selecting data roaming may incur additional costs. Refer to your tariff plan.
Connecting via packet data may incur additional charges. Continue?

"Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will not be able to use the Internet, Email or other apps that require a data connection.
Turn off Mobile data?"

"Your phone's Video Calling function won't work when mobile data is off. Also, you won't be able to use the Internet, Email or other apps that need a data connection unless you use Wi-Fi. Turn off the mobile data connection?"

"Unless you use WLAN, you will no longer be able to use Internet, Email, or other apps that require a data connection.
Mobile data will be disabled."
"Unless you connect to a Wi-Fi network, you won't be able to use Internet, Email or other apps that require a network connection."

"Unless you use Wi-Fi, you will no longer be able to use Internet, Email, or other apps that require a data connection.
Mobile data will be disabled."

"If Mobile data is turned off, your device must be connected to a Wi-Fi network to use services that require a network connection.
Mobile data will be turned off."
Video calls automatically switch to voice calls when you dial numbers that do not support video calls.
Remote screen control mode enabled. Screen will be controlled remotely when connected to network provider
Remote screen control mode disabled. Screen will not be controlled remotely when connected to network provider
Select to show pop-ups about video call quality.
Service provider not allowed to disable VoLTE
%s will be dialed by tapping OK. Dial now?
Enhance the overall call sound quality.
Unable to enable Adapt Sound while the speaker is on.
Unable to enable Adapt Sound while the earphones are connected.
Unable to enable Adapt Sound while the Bluetooth headset is on.
Unable to enable Adapt sound while Extra volume is turned on.
Video calls not supported in international roaming area
Data roaming abroad may incur excessive charges depending on the policies of the local network provider

"You are using a USIM card from a service provider other than LG U+. Your service has been restricted according to your data plan.
- If your service provider is SKT, enable 3G network mode if you have a 3G data plan, or enable 3G or LTE network mode if you have an LTE data plan.
You can only use data services if you have enabled LTE network mode.
- If your service provider is KT, enable 3G network mode regardless of your data plan. The LTE service is not supported by your service provider.
- If you enable 3G network mode, you will only be able to use the phone, messaging, and data service functions.
To change your network mode, go to Settings > More networks > Mobile networks > Mobile network methods and then select 3G network mode or LTE network mode."
To turn on Mobile data, go to Settings, then select Data usage.
Enabling data roaming may incur excessive charges depending on the policies of the local network provider. Continue?
Connecting to mobile data networks allowed. Your device will be able to access data services, such as GPS data transmission, or synchronization, without your authorization.

Data roaming may incur additional charges in addition to your domestic flat rate plan. Automatic updates for Email or applications may also incur additional charges. Using large-data services such as video or Email may incur charges over 20,000 won per minute.
"Connecting to mobile networks… Additional charges may be incurred if you are not using a flat rate data plan"
To use data roaming, go to Settings > Connections > Global roaming, then enable Data roaming.
Mobile data will be turned on. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Mobile data will be turned on to use GiGA LTE. This may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.
Mobile data will be turned on. Connecting to mobile networks may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.

"While data roaming is enabled, <u><font color=\"%1$s\">international data roaming charges will apply instead of domestic data charges.</font></u>
<u><font color=\"%1$s\">Enable restrict background data to reduce data roaming charges</font></u> by disabling features such as IM notifications and automatic updates."
Data roaming enabled. Note that high data charges may apply depending on your payment plan and location.
Automatically add international call prefix (+) and country code when making a roaming call
Failed to set target country code
Authentication failed. Dial 114 to contact help desk.
To connect to LGU+ roaming network settings will be changed to Auto settings and the phone will restart.
LTE roaming has been disabled. You have entered another country. To use LTE, enable LTE roaming.
Resetting roaming settings. This may take up to 3 minutes. Please wait…
"Switching from service provider's network to roaming network…"
"Switching from roaming network to service provider's network…"
You can easily make calls from overseas, as the international access code (+) and the country code are added automatically.
Go to Settings > Global roaming > Auto dialing settings > enable or disable auto dialing.
Tap the auto dialing button in the dialing keypad to enable/disable.
The default auto dialing target country is South Korea (+82), but this can be changed to another country.
Go to Settings > Global roaming > Auto dialing settings > select the target country code.
To set the country code, tap and hold the auto dialing button in the dialing keypad.
Tap to disable use LTE when available.
"Access to mobile network blocked by service provider. Contact customer services (1544-0010)."

A network service that diverts incoming calls to a specified number when you are unable to answer calls, for example when you are on the device or your device is off. You first need to subscribe to the service. Contact customer center (114+Send) to subscribe or unsubscribe to this service. Enter *72+number to forward calls to+Send to enable, or *720+Send to disable.

A network service that diverts all incoming calls and text messages to a specified number. You have to subscribe to this service. You will be charged with monthly fee. Contact the customer center (114+Send) to subscribe or unsubscribe to this service; enter *71+number to forward calls to+Send to enable, or *710+Send to disable.
A free network service that allows you to answer a second call during a call, placing the first call on hold. Enter *40+Send to enable, or *400+Send to disable.
Unregistered subscriber. Check your registration status and try again.
Unregistered service. Contact customer center to register service.
Restricted service. Unblock incoming calls and try again.
No value entered. Check the values and try again.
Entered values are out of range. Check the values and try again.
Unregistered subscriber. Check your registration status and try again.
Verify the number and try again.
Set up easy international call dialing while roaming.

Assisted dialing allows you to easily make international calls while roaming in another country. First, set the country setting to your home location. You may also edit the International call prefix, the International direct dialing (IDD) prefixes, the National direct dialing (NDD) prefixes, City/area codes, and the national number length.
Reduce the probability of being interrupted during calls.
Network ID should be 5 or 6 digits.
Item not saved. Check the Network ID
Connect to mobile networks while roaming.

"Using data while in the US, including Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico and US Virgin Islands, will bill according to your data plan.
Using data during trips outside of the US without a global data plan may result in significantly higher charges.
Do you want to turn on data?"
To sign up for a global data plan, call global support at 908-559-4899
Allow access only for this trip
Deny data access for this trip
Allow data access for this trip
Global Data Roaming Access Allowed Significantly activated. Higher charges may apply
This setting disables 2G service on the device. If 2G service is disabled, some apps and functions may not work in locations with limited coverage.
After you disable 2G, you will be unable to make emergency and non-emergency phone calls if you are in a location where only 2G is available. Do you wish to continue?
Unable to make group video call. Check network status.
For %s, you can add up to %d participants.
Video conference calls are only available via LTE network.
Unable to call personal emergency contact. Network not available.
Drag the green home button right to go to the home screen. Drag the red button left to exit Emergency callback mode
Enabling Data roaming may result in additional charges depending on your payment plan.

"You are currently roaming on another carrier’s network. Access to data services may be inconsistent and incur significant charges. Data roaming may be modified and/or turned off in “Roaming settings”."
You are currently roaming internationally. Limited data services are available as part of your service plan, but may need to be enabled. Faster data speeds may be available for purchase.

Failed to register to network. Power off your device, then power it back on again.

Network registration in progress. Try again in a moment.

Unable to connect to set network manually. Set up network again?

Failed to authenticate the device. Contact customer services.
Number not registered. If this problem persists, contact customer center (%s).
Authentication failed. If this problem persists, contact customer center (%s).
Device authentication failed. If this problem persists, contact customer center (%s).
Registration failed. If this problem persists, contact customer center (%s).

Mobile networks are currently blocked. To use mobile networks, contact the customer service center.
Unable to connect to network. If this problem persists, contact customer center (%s).
Unable to use the global roaming service. If this problem persists after restarting your device, contact the LG U+ customer center (%s).
Unable to use the global roaming service. Contact the LG U+ customer center (%s) if you want to use data.

Unable to connect with the telecommunications company. Try again later. If the problem persists, contact the LG U+ customer center (%s).

Wi-Fi Calling let you call and text while on a Wi-Fi Network. Usage will be deducted from the minute and text message buckets in your Wireless plan. Click below to Activate.
Please connect to a Wi-Fi Network to register for Wi-Fi Calling.

Wi-Fi Calling needs to use your location information. Location will be enabled. Anonymous location data will be collected and sent to Google and your service provider. Contact your service provider for details.
Click here to register for Wi-Fi Calling or to update your existing Emergency Address.
Wi-Fi Calling is a service that allows you to make and receive calls and texts via a Wi-Fi connection. The usage is deducted from your airtime/messaging buckets in your wireless plan.

"This allows you to keep using your phone in places where you don't have cellular coverage - like basements, condos and tall buildings. Also, if you are using Wi-Fi Calling while roaming, all of your incoming calls and outgoing calls and messages to Canadian numbers are deducted from your airtime and messaging buckets included in your wireless plan."
"The icon below will appear at the top of your device's screen when your device is ready to use Wi-Fi Calling."
1. On the device home page, press the “Phone” icon
3. Click the registration link and follow the setup process
Call and text over Wi-Fi. If Wi-Fi is not available, call and text over the cellular network. (Recommended to avoid dropped calls)
Call and text over the cellular network. If cellular is not available, call and text over Wi-Fi.

To add emergency contacts, go to the Contacts app > More options button > Groups > ICE - emergency contacts, then tap EDIT.
Change roaming settings for your network.

"Wi-Fi calling is an Orange service that enables you to make and receive calls through a Wi-Fi connection, even if there is no mobile network coverage. This allows calling where it was impossible before like basements, ground floors or inside large buildings.
To use Wi-Fi calling, first connect to a Wi-Fi network, and then activate the service in Settings > Wi-Fi calling.
The first time that you activate the service, Orange will send you a confirmation message the moment the service is available.
Wi-Fi calls will be charged based on your tariff plan.
Whenever this feature is available, you will see the Wi-Fi calling icon in the upper part of the screen."

"If you select Wi-Fi network preferred, Wi-Fi network will be used to establish calls by default. In case you are not connected to any Wi-Fi network or Wi-Fi strength is weak, mobile network will be used to establish calls.
If you select mobile network preferred, mobile network will be used to establish calls by default. In case there is no or weak mobile coverage, Wi-Fi network will be used instead."
Use Wi-Fi networks to make and receive calls anywhere in metropolitan France, without connecting to a mobile network.

WiFi Calling is the service providing the ability to make and receive voice calls over the Internet connection in any available WiFi network, even if you are out of mobile coverage. The WiFi Calling icon on the notification bar (shown below) indicate that all your calls are using WiFi Calling.

"In a case the WiFi connection is getting weak or you get out of the WiFi coverage your mobile phone would switch to mobile network.
Using WiFi Calling is rated according to the service rates provided by your mobile operator. Details on www.orange.pl/wificalling
Please note that calls to Emergency Numbers eg.112 will be routed through a mobille network. In case there is no mobile coverage the Emergency Calls could be routed via WiFi Calling service. In such cases your mobile operator may not be able to determine your exact location information and therefore would route your call to the Emergency Centre which is not the closest one for your actual location."

WiFi Calling lets you make and receive voice calls over any WiFi network available, even if you are out of mobile coverage. The WiFi Calling icon on the notification bar indicates that all your calls are using WiFi Calling.

"More information about the service provided by your mobile operator could be found at www.orange.pl/wificalling
Choose the SETTINGS menu below to activate your WiFi Calling service on your mobile device."

Emergency calls are not possible via Wi-Fi Calling. The device switches automatically to a cellular network (2G/3G) to place an emergency call. Emergency calls are only possible in areas with cellular coverage.
Your location information might be sent to your service provider while you are using Wi-Fi calling. Contact your service provider for details.
Your location-related information can be sent to Google and your operator in order to establish Wi-Fi calls, whether you have activated or not the location feature.
When you see VoWiFi icon in your notification bar you can call using any WiFi network around the world at the local price of your data plan! More information here.

The Claro VoWiFi service has been activated. When the service icon appears on the status bar, it means you can make calls using any Wi-Fi network, inside or outside of the country, for the same price as your Claro plan! Tap here for more information.
"Wi-Fi Calling is a service of your mobile operator, Orange Polska S.A. Please read the description of the service provided by your operator:"

Wi-Fi Calling service enables you to make and receive voice calls over any Wi-Fi internet connection, even in a situation where you are outside any mobile network’s coverage. Once the service is active for your mobile number, every time you connect to a Wi-Fi network, your voice calls will be performed using Wi-Fi Calling. This will be indicated to you by a dedicated icon on the notification bar.

"If your Wi-Fi connection is of poor quality or your device is outside a Wi-Fi network’s coverage, your phone will make calls using an available mobile network.
Calls you make with Wi-Fi Calling in Poland are charged in the same way as your regular mobile calls in your mobile tariff plan. Incoming calls in Poland are free of charge. If you make Wi-Fi Calling calls outside Poland your calls may be charged a price specified in your mobile tariff plan’s price list.
Notwithstanding, your Wi-Fi connections may be charged independently by the provider of your Wi-Fi connection."

"Once you press the [I ACCEPT] button and your phone connects to a Wi-Fi network, your Wi-Fi Calling service will be activated. You can disable Wi-Fi Calling at any time using the phone menu.
Detailed information about your Wi-Fi Calling service can be found at www.orange.pl/wificalling.
Please note that in order to enable your emergency calls (e.g., such as 112 calls) to be routed to the closest emergency centre suitable for your actual location, your emergency calls made while the Wi-Fi Calling service is enabled will be carried by your device through any mobile network available at a given moment. Only in cases where no mobile network is available will an emergency call be routed via the Wi-Fi Calling service. Unfortunately, in such cases we will not know your precise location and therefore your emergency call may not be routed to the emergency centre closest to your actual location."

In regard to your use of Wi-Fi Calling, we – as your personal data controller – will process your data based on the number and model of the device on which you use Wi-Fi Calling, the software used on the device, the endpoint of the network used to connect with Wi-Fi Calling (including the IP address and the country to which this IP address is attributed), and the time and duration of each call, in order to perform and settle the service, answer any complaints, and to perform any statutory obligations. We will process this data for the duration of the agreement on providing telecommunication services between you and us, and after its termination – for the period of recovery of claims and of performing other tasks defined in the provisions of law. Providing the data is voluntary, but it is necessary to use the service. You have the right to access and to rectify your data.

Please find our data: Orange Polska S.A., address: Aleje Jerozolimskie 160, 02-326 Warsaw, Poland, registered in the Register of the Entrepreneurs of District Court for the Capital City of Warsaw in Warsaw, XII Commercial Division of the National Court Register (KRS), under entry number 0000010681, NIP (tax ID) 526-02-50-995; with share capital (fully paid up) of PLN 3,937,072,437.00.
